segment_text: Arturo Icaza de Arana-Goldberg, Police Detective Third Grade, United North American Trading Sphere, Third District, Fourth Prefecture, Second Division (Parkdale) had had many adventures in his distinguished career, running crooks to ground with an unbeatable combination of instinct and unstinting devotion to duty.
scene_description: indoors, cluttered sitting room, bedroom with messy bed, morning light

segment_text: He’d been decorated on three separate occasions by his commander and by the Regional Manager for Social Harmony, and his mother kept a small shrine dedicated to his press clippings and commendations that occupied most of the cramped sitting-room of her flat off Steeles Avenue.
scene_description: indoors, cluttered sitting room, bedroom with messy bed, morning light

segment_text: No amount of policeman’s devotion and skill availed him when it came to making his twelve-year-old get ready for school, though.
scene_description: indoors, cluttered sitting room, bedroom with messy bed, morning light

segment_text: “Haul ass, young lady—out of bed, on your feet, shit-shower-shave, or I swear to God, I will beat you purple and shove you out the door jaybird naked. Capeesh?”
scene_description: indoors, cluttered sitting room, bedroom with messy bed, morning light

segment_text: The mound beneath the covers groaned and hissed. “You are a terrible father,” it said.
scene_description: indoors, cluttered sitting room, bedroom with messy bed, morning light

segment_text: “And I never loved you.” The voice was indistinct and muffled by the pillow.
scene_description: indoors, cluttered sitting room, bedroom with messy bed, morning light

segment_text: “Boo hoo,” Arturo said, examining his nails. “You’ll regret that when I’m dead of cancer.”
scene_description: indoors, cluttered sitting room, bedroom with messy bed, morning light

segment_text: The mound—whose name was Ada Trouble Icaza de Arana-Goldberg—threw her covers off and sat bolt upright. “You’re dying of cancer? is it testicle cancer?”
scene_description: indoors, cluttered sitting room, bedroom with messy bed, morning light

segment_text: Ada clapped her hands and squealed. “Can I have your stuff?”
scene_description: indoors, cluttered sitting room, bedroom with messy bed, morning light

segment_text: “Ten minutes, your rottenness,” he said, and then his breath caught momentarily in his breast as he saw, fleetingly, his ex-wife’s morning expression, not seen these past twelve years, come to life in his daughter’s face.
scene_description: indoors, cluttered sitting room, bedroom with messy bed, morning light

segment_text: Pouty, pretty, sleepy and guile-less, and it made him realize that his daughter was becoming a woman, growing away from him. She was, and he was not ready for that.
scene_description: indoors, cluttered sitting room, bedroom with messy bed, morning light

segment_text: He shook it off, patted his razor-burn and turned on his heel. He knew from experience that once roused, the munchkin would be scrounging the kitchen for whatever was handy before dashing out the door, and if he hurried, he’d have eggs and sausage on the table before she made her brief appearance.
scene_description: indoors, cluttered sitting room, bedroom with messy bed, morning light

segment_text: Otherwise he’d have to pry the sugar-cereal out of her hands—and she fought dirty.
scene_description: indoors, cluttered sitting room, bedroom with messy bed, morning light

segment_text: In his car, he prodded at his phone. He had her wiretapped, of course.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: He was a cop—every phone and every computer was an open book to him, so that this involved nothing more than dialing a number on his special copper’s phone, entering her number and a PIN, and then listening as his daughter had truck with a criminal enterprise.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: “Welcome to ExcuseClub! There are 43 members on the network this morning. You have five excuses to your credit. Press one to redeem an excuse—” She toned one.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: “Press one if you need an adult—” Tone. “Press one if you need a woman; press two if you need a man—” Tone.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: “Press one if your excuse should be delivered by your doctor; press two for your spiritual representative; press three for your case-worker; press four for your psycho-health specialist; press five for your son; press six for your father—” Tone.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: “You have selected to have your excuse delivered by your father. Press one if this excuse is intended for your case-worker; press two for your psycho-health specialist; press three for your principal—” Tone.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: “Please dictate your excuse at the sound of the beep. When you have finished, press the pound key.”
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: “This is Detective Arturo Icaza de Arana-Goldberg. My daughter was sick in the night and I’ve let her sleep in. She’ll be in for lunchtime.” Tone.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: “Press one to hear your message; press two to have your message dispatched to a network-member.” Tone. “Thank you.”
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: The pen-trace data scrolled up Arturo’s phone—number called, originating number, call-time. This was the third time he’d caught his daughter at this game, and each time, the pen-trace data had been useless, a dead-end lead that terminated with a phone-forwarding service tapped into one of the dodgy offshore switches that the blessed blasted UNATS brass had recently acquired on the cheap to handle the surge of mobile telephone calls.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: Why couldn’t they just stick to UNATS Robotics equipment, like the good old days? Those Oceanic switches had more back-doors than a speakeasy, trade agreements be damned.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: They were attractive nuisances, invitations to criminal activity. Arturo fumed and drummed his fingers on the steering-wheel.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: Each time he’d caught Ada at this, she’d used the extra time to crawl back into bed for a leisurely morning, but who knew if today was the day she took her liberty and went downtown with it, to some parental nightmare of a drug-den?
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: Some place where the old pervert chickenhawks hung out, the kind of men he arrested in burlesque house raids, men who masturbated into their hats under their tables and then put them back onto their shining pates, dripping cold, diseased serum onto their scalps. He clenched his hands on the steering wheel and cursed.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: In an ideal world, he’d simply follow her. He was good at tailing, and his unmarked car with its tinted windows was a UNATS Robotics standard compact #2, indistinguishable from the tens of thousands of others just like it on the streets of Toronto.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: Ada would never know that the curb-crawler tailing her was her sucker of a father, making sure that she turned up to get her brains sharpened instead of turning into some stunadz doper with her underage butt hanging out of a little skirt on Jarvis Street.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: In the real world, Arturo had thirty minutes to make a forty minute downtown and crosstown commute if he was going to get to the station house on-time for the quarterly all-hands Social Harmony briefing. Which meant that he needed to be in two places at once, which meant that he had to use—the robot.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: Swallowing bile, he speed-dialed a number on his phone. “This is R Peed Robbert, McNicoll and Don Mills bus-shelter.”
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: “That’s nice. This is Detective Icaza de Arana-Goldberg, three blocks east of you on Picola. Proceed to my location at once, priority urgent, no sirens.”
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: “Acknowledged. It is my pleasure to do you a service, Detective.” “Shut up,” he said, and hung up the phone.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: The R Peed—Robot, Police Department—robots were the worst, programmed to be friendly to a fault, even as they surveilled and snitched out every person who walked past their eternally vigilant, ever-remembering electrical eyes and brains. The R Peeds could outrun a police car on open ground or highway.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: He’d barely had time to untwist his clenched hands from the steering wheel when R Peed Robbert was at his window, politely rapping on the smoked glass. He didn’t want to roll down the window.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: Didn’t want to smell the dry, machine-oil smell of a robot. He phoned it instead.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: “You are now tasked to me, Detective’s override, acknowledge.” The metal man bowed, its symmetrical, simplified features pleasant and guileless.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: It clicked its heels together with an audible snick as those marvelous, spring-loaded, nuclear-powered gams whined through their parody of obedience. “Acknowledged, Detective. It is my pleasure to do—”
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: “Shut up. You will discreetly surveil 55 Picola Crescent until such time as Ada Trouble Icaza de Arana-Goldberg, Social Harmony serial number 0MDY2-T3937 leaves the premises. Then you will maintain discreet surveillance. If she deviates more than 10 percent from the optimum route between here and Don Mills Collegiate Institute, you will notify me. Acknowledge.”
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: “Acknowledged, Detective. It is my—” He hung up and told the UNATS Robotics mechanism running his car to get him down to the station house as fast as it could, angry with himself and with Ada—whose middle name was Trouble, after all—for making him deal with a robot before he’d had his morning meditation and destim session.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: The name had been his ex-wife’s idea, something she’d insisted on long enough to make sure that it got onto the kid’s birth certificate before defecting to Eurasia with their life’s savings, leaving him with a new baby and the deep suspicion of his co-workers who wondered if he wouldn’t go and join her. His ex-wife.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: He hadn’t thought of her in years. Well, months. Weeks, certainly.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: She’d been a brilliant computer scientist, the valedictorian of her Positronic Complexity Engineering class at the UNATS Robotics school at the University of Toronto. Dumping her husband and her daughter was bad enough, but the worst of it was that she dumped her country and its way of life.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: Now she was ensconced in her own research lab in Beijing, making the kinds of runaway Positronics that made the loathsome robots of UNATS look categorically beneficent. He itched to wiretap her, to read her email or listen in on her phone conversations.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: He could have done that when they were still together, but he never had. If he had, he would have found out what she was planning. He could have talked her out of it.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: And then what, Artie? said the nagging voice in his head. Arrest her if she wouldn’t listen to you?
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: March her down to the station house in handcuffs and have her put away for treason? Send her to the reeducation camp with your little daughter still in her belly?
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: Shut up, he told the nagging voice, which had a robotic quality to it for all its sneering cruelty, a tenor of syrupy false friendliness. He called up the pen-trace data and texted it to the phreak squad.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: They had bots that handled this kind of routine work and they texted him back in an instant. He remembered when that kind of query would take a couple of hours, and he liked the fast response, but what about the conversations he’d have with the phone cop who called him back, the camaraderie, the back-and-forth?
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: TRACE TERMINATES WITH A VIRTUAL SERVICE CIRCUIT AT SWITCH PNG.433-GKRJC. VIRTUAL CIRCUIT FORWARDS TO A COMPROMISED “ZOMBIE” SYSTEM IN NINTH DISTRICT, FIRST PREFECTURE.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: ZOMBIE HAS BEEN SHUT DOWN AND LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT IS EN ROUTE FOR PICKUP AND FORENSICS. IT IS MY PLEASURE TO DO YOU A SERVICE, DETECTIVE.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: How could you have a back-and-forth with a message like that? He looked up Ninth/First in the metric-analog map converter: KEY WEST, FL.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: So, there you had it. A switch made in Papua New-Guinea (which persisted in conjuring up old Oceanic war photos of bone-in-nose types from his boyhood, though now that they’d been at war with Eurasia for so long, it was hard to even find someone who didn’t think that the war had always been with Eurasia, that Oceania hadn’t always been UNATS’s ally), forwarding calls to a computer that was so far south, it was practically in the middle of the Caribbean, hardly a stone’s throw from the CAFTA region, which was well-known to harbor Eurasian saboteur and terrorist elements.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: The car shuddered as it wove in and out of the lanes on the Don Valley Parkway, barreling for the Gardiner Express Way, using his copper’s override to make the thick, slow traffic part ahead of him. He wasn’t supposed to do this, but as between a minor infraction and pissing off the man from Social Harmony, he knew which one he’d pick.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: His phone rang again. It was R Peed Robbert, checking in.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: “Hello, Detective,” it said, its voice crackling from bad reception. “Subject Ada Trouble Icaza de Arana-Goldberg has deviated from her route. She is continuing north on Don Mills past Van Horne and is continuing toward Sheppard.”
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: Sheppard meant the Sheppard subway, which meant that she was going farther. “Continue discreet surveillance.”
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: He thought about the overcoat men with their sticky hats. “If she attempts to board the subway, alert the truancy patrol.” He cursed again.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: Maybe she was just going to the mall. But he couldn’t go up there himself and make sure, and it wasn’t like a robot would be any use in restraining her, she’d just second-law it into letting her go.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: Useless castrating clanking job-stealing dehumanizing— She was almost certainly just going to the mall. She was a smart kid, a good kid—a rotten kid, to be sure, but good-rotten.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: Chances were she’d be trying on clothes and flirting with boys until lunch and then walking boldly back into class. He ballparked it at an 80 percent probability.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: If it had been a perp, 80 percent might have been good enough. But this was his Ada. Dammit.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: He had 10 minutes until the Social Harmony meeting started, and he was still 15 minutes away from the stationhouse—and 20 from Ada. “Tail her,” he said.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: “Just tail her. Keep me up to date on your location at 90-second intervals.” “It is my pleasure to—”
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: He dropped the phone on the passenger seat and went back to fretting about the Social Harmony meeting.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: The man from Social Harmony noticed right away that Arturo was checking his phone at 90-second intervals. He was a bald, thin man with a pronounced Adam’s apple, beak-nose and shiny round head that combined to give him the profile of something predatory and fast.
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: In his natty checked suit and pink tie, the Social Harmony man was the stuff of nightmares, the kind of eagle-eyed supercop who could spot Arturo’s attention flicking for the barest moment every 90 seconds to his phone and then back to the meeting. “Detective?” he said.
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: Arturo looked up from his screen, keeping his expression neutral, not acknowledging the mean grins from the other four ranking detectives in the meeting. Silently, he turned his phone face-down on the meeting table.
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: “Thank you,” he said. “Now, the latest stats show a sharp rise in grey-market electronics importing and other tariff-breaking crimes, mostly occurring in open-air market stalls and from sidewalk blankets. I know that many in law enforcement treat this kind of thing as mere hand-to-hand piracy, not worth troubling with, but I want to assure you, gentlemen and lady, that Social Harmony takes these crimes very seriously indeed.”
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: The Social Harmony man lifted his computer onto the desk, steadying it with both hands, then plugged it into the wall socket. Detective Shainblum went to the wall and unlatched the cover for the projector-wire and dragged it over to the Social Harmony computer and plugged it in, snapping shut the hardened collar.
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: The sound of the projector-fan spinning up was like a helicopter. “Here,” the Social Harmony man said, bringing up a slide, “here we have what appears to be a standard AV set-top box from Korea. Looks like a UNATS Robotics player, but it’s a third the size and plays twice as many formats.
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: Random Social Harmony audits have determined that as much as forty percent of UNATS residents have this device or one like it in their homes, despite its illegality. It may be that one of you detectives has such a device in your home, and it’s likely that one of your family members does.”
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: He advanced the slide. Now they were looking at a massive car-wreck on a stretch of highway somewhere where the pine-trees grew tall.
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: The wreck was so enormous that even for the kind of seasoned veteran of road-fatality porn who was accustomed to adding up the wheels and dividing by four it was impossible to tell exactly how many cars were involved.
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: “Components from a Eurasian bootleg set-top box were used to modify the positronic brains of three cars owned by teenagers near Goderich. All modifications were made at the same garage. These modifications allowed these children to operate their vehicles unsafely so that they could participate in drag racing events on major highways during off-hours. This is the result. Twenty-two fatalities, nine major injuries. Three minors—besides the drivers—killed, and one pregnant woman.”
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: “We’ve shut down the garage and taken those responsible into custody, but it doesn’t matter. The Eurasians deliberately manufacture their components to interoperate with UNATS Robotics brains, and so long as their equipment circulates within UNATS borders, there will be moderately skilled hackers who take advantage of this fact to introduce dangerous, anti-social modifications into our nation’s infrastructure.”
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: “This quarter is the quarter that Social Harmony and law enforcement dry up the supply of Eurasian electronics. We have added new sniffers and border-patrols, new customs agents and new detector vans. Beat officers have been instructed to arrest any street dealer they encounter and district attorneys will be asking for the maximum jail time for them. This is the war on the home-front, detectives, and it’s every bit as serious as the shooting war.”
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: “Your part in this war, as highly trained, highly decorated detectives, will be to use snitches, arrest-trails and seized evidence to track down higher-level suppliers, the ones who get the dealers their goods. And then Social Harmony wants you to get their suppliers, and so on, up the chain—to run the corruption to ground and to bring it to a halt.
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: The Social Harmony dossier on Eurasian importers is updated hourly, and has a high-capacity positronic interface that is available to answer your questions and accept your input for synthesis into its analytical model. We are relying on you to feed the dossier, to give it the raw materials and then to use it to win this war.”
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: The Social Harmony man paged through more atrocity slides, scenes from the home-front: poisoned buildings with berserk life-support systems, violent kung-fu movies playing in the background in crack-houses, then kids playing sexually explicit, violent arcade games imported from Japan. Arturo’s hand twitched toward his mobile.
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: What was Ada up to now? The meeting drew to a close and Arturo risked looking at his mobile under the table.
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: R. Peed Robbert had checked in five more times, shadowing Ada around the mall and then had fallen silent. Arturo cursed.
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: Fucking robots were useless. Social Harmony should be hunting down UNATS Robotics products, too.
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: The Social Harmony man cleared his throat meaningfully. Arturo put the phone away. “Detective Icaza de Arana-Goldberg?”
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: “Sir,” he said, gathering up his personal computer so that he’d have an excuse to go—no one could be expected to hold one of UNATS Robotics’s heavy luggables for very long. The Social Harmony man stepped in close enough that Arturo could smell the eggs and coffee on his breath.
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: “I hope we haven’t kept you from anything important, detective.” “No, sir,” Arturo said, shifting the computer in his arms. “My apologies. Just monitoring a tail from an R Peed unit.”
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: “I see,” the Social Harmony man said. “Listen, you know these components that the Eurasians are turning out. It’s no coincidence that they interface so well with UNATS Robotics equipment: they’re using defected UNATS Robotics engineers and scientists to design their electronics for maximum interoperability.”
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: The Social Harmony man let that hang in the air. Defected scientists. His ex-wife was the highest-ranking UNATS technician to go over to Eurasia.
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: This was her handiwork, and the Social Harmony man wanted to be sure that Arturo understood that. But Arturo had already figured that out during the briefing.
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: His ex-wife was thousands of kilometers away, but he was keenly aware that he was always surrounded by her handiwork. The little illegal robot-pet eggs they’d started seeing last year: she’d made him one of those for their second date, and now they were draining the productive hours of half the children of UNATS, demanding to be “fed” and “hugged.”
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: His had died within 48 hours of her giving it to him. He shifted the computer in his arms some more and let his expression grow pained.
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: “I’ll keep that in mind, sir,” he said. “You do that,” said the man from Social Harmony.
scene_description: indoors, conference table, projector screen, wall sockets, office chairs

segment_text: He phoned R Peed Robbert the second he reached his desk. The phone rang three times, then disconnected.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, computer terminal, police station background

segment_text: He redialed. Twice.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, computer terminal, police station background

segment_text: Then he grabbed his jacket and ran to the car. A light autumn rain had started up, ending the Indian summer that Toronto—the Fourth Prefecture in the new metric scheme—had been enjoying.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: It made the roads slippery and the UNATS Robotics chauffeur skittish about putting the hammer down on the Don Valley Parkway. He idly fantasized about finding a set-top box and plugging it into his car somehow so that he could take over the driving without alerting his superiors.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: Instead, he redialed R Peed Robbert, but the robot wasn’t even ringing any longer. He zoomed in on the area around Sheppard and Don Mills with his phone and put out a general call for robots.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: More robots. “This is R Peed Froderick, Fairview Mall parking lot, third level.”
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: Arturo sent the robot R Peed Robbert’s phone number and set it to work translating that into a locator-beacon code and then told it to find Robbert and report in. “It is my—”
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: He watched R Peed Froderick home in on the locator for Robbert, which was close by, at the other end of the mall, near the Don Valley Parkway exit. He switched to a view from Froderick’s electric eyes, but quickly switched away, nauseated by the sickening leaps and spins of an R Peed moving at top speed, clanging off walls and ceilings.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: His phone rang. It was R Peed Froderick.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: “Hello, Detective. I have found R Peed Robbert. The Peed unit has been badly damaged by some kind of electromagnetic pulse. I will bring him to the nearest station-house for forensic analysis now.”
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: “Wait!” Arturo said, trying to understand what he’d been told. The Peed units were so efficient—by the time they’d given you the sitrep, they’d already responded to the situation in perfect police procedure, but the problem was they worked so fast you couldn’t even think about what they were doing, couldn’t formulate any kind of hypothesis.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: Electromagnetic pulse? The Peed units were hardened against snooping, sniffing, pulsing, sideband and brute-force attacks.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: You’d have to hit one with a bolt of lightning to kill it. “Wait there,” Arturo said. “Do not leave the scene. Await my presence. Do not modify the scene or allow anyone else to do so. Acknowledge.”
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: “It is my—” But this time, it wasn’t Arturo switching off the phone, it was the robot. Had the robot just hung up on him?
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: He redialed it. No answer.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: He reached under his dash and flipped the first and second alert switches and the car leapt forward. He’d have to fill out some serious paperwork to justify a two-switch override on the Parkway, but two robots was more than a coincidence.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: Besides, a little paperwork was nothing compared to the fireworks ahead when he phoned up Ada to ask her what she was doing out of school. He hit her speed-dial and fumed while the phone rang three times.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: Then it cut into voicemail. He tried a pen-trace, but Ada hadn’t made any calls since her ExcuseClub call that morning.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: He texted the phreak squad to see if they could get a fix on her location from the bug in her phone, but it was either powered down or out of range. He put a watch on it—any location data it transmitted when it got back to civilization would be logged.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: It was possible that she was just in the mall. It was a big place—some of the cavernous stores were so well-shielded with radio-noisy animated displays that they gonked any phones brought inside them.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: She could be with her girlfriends, trying on brassieres and having a real bonding moment. But there was no naturally occurring phenomenon associated with the mall that nailed R Peeds with bolts of lightning.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: He approached the R Peeds cautiously, using his copper’s override to make the dumb little positronic brain in the emergency exit nearest their last known position open up for him without tipping off the building’s central brain.
scene_description: indoors, narrow corridor, pipes overhead, concrete floor, emergency exit door

segment_text: He crept along a service corridor, heading for a door that exited into the mall.
scene_description: indoors, narrow corridor, pipes overhead, concrete floor, emergency exit door

segment_text: He put one hand on the doorknob and the other on his badge, took a deep breath and stepped out. A mall security guard nearly jumped out of his skin as he emerged.
scene_description: indoors, wide mall concourse, storefronts, escalator, tiled floor

segment_text: He reached for his pepper-spray and Arturo swept it out of his hand as he flipped his badge up and showed it to the man. “Police,” he said, in the cop-voice, the one that worked on everyone except his daughter and his ex-wife and the bloody robots.
scene_description: indoors, wide mall concourse, storefronts, escalator, tiled floor

segment_text: “Sorry,” the guard said, recovering his pepper spray. He had an Oceanic twang in his voice, something Arturo had been hearing more and more as the crowded islands of the South Pacific boiled over UNATS.
scene_description: indoors, wide mall concourse, storefronts, escalator, tiled floor

segment_text: Before them, in a pile, were many dead robots: both of the R Peed units, a pair of mall-sweepers, a flying cambot, and a squat, octopus-armed maintenance robot, lying in a lifeless tangle. Some of them were charred around their seams, and there was the smell of fried motherboards in the air.
scene_description: indoors, wide mall concourse, storefronts, escalator, tiled floor

segment_text: As they watched, a sweeper bot swept forward and grabbed the maintenance bot by one of its fine manipulators. “Oi, stoppit,” the security guard said, and the robot second-lawed to an immediate halt.
scene_description: indoors, wide mall concourse, storefronts, escalator, tiled floor

segment_text: “No, that’s fine, go back to work,” Arturo said, shooting a look at the rent-a-cop. He watched closely as the sweeper bot began to drag the heavy maintenance unit away, thumbing the backup number into his phone with one hand.
scene_description: indoors, wide mall concourse, storefronts, escalator, tiled floor

segment_text: He wanted more cops on the scene, real ones, and fast. The sweeper bot managed to take one step backwards towards its service corridor when the lights dimmed and a crack-bang sound filled the air.
scene_description: indoors, wide mall concourse, storefronts, escalator, tiled floor

segment_text: Then it, too was lying on the ground. Arturo hit send on his phone and clamped it to his head, and as he did, noticed the strong smell of burning plastic.
scene_description: indoors, wide mall concourse, storefronts, escalator, tiled floor

segment_text: He looked at his phone: the screen had gone charred black, and its little idiot lights were out. He flipped it over and pried out the battery with a fingernail, then yelped and dropped it—it was hot enough to raise a blister on his fingertip, and when it hit the ground, it squished meltfully against the mall-tiles.
scene_description: indoors, wide mall concourse, storefronts, escalator, tiled floor

segment_text: “Mine’s dead, too, mate,” the security guard said. “Everyfing is—cash registers, bots, credit-cards.”
scene_description: indoors, wide mall concourse, storefronts, escalator, tiled floor

segment_text: Fearing the worst, Arturo reached under his jacket and withdrew his sidearm. It was a UNATS Robotics model, with a little snitch-brain that recorded when, where and how it was drawn.
scene_description: indoors, wide mall concourse, storefronts, escalator, tiled floor

segment_text: He worked the action and found it frozen in place. The gun was as dead as the robot. He swore.
scene_description: indoors, wide mall concourse, storefronts, escalator, tiled floor

segment_text: “Give me your pepper spray and your truncheon,” he said to the security guard. “No way,” the guard said. “Getcherown. It’s worth my job if I lose these.”
scene_description: indoors, wide mall concourse, storefronts, escalator, tiled floor

segment_text: “I’ll have you deported if you give me one more second’s worth of bullshit,” Arturo said. Ada had led the first R Peed unit here, and it had been fried by some piece of very ugly infowar equipment.
scene_description: indoors, wide mall concourse, storefronts, escalator, tiled floor

segment_text: He wasn’t going to argue with this Oceanic boat-person for one instant longer. He reached out and took the pepper spray out of the guard’s hand. “Truncheon,” he said.
scene_description: indoors, wide mall concourse, storefronts, escalator, tiled floor

segment_text: “I’ve got your bloody badge number,” the security guard said. “And I’ve got witnesses.” He gestured at the hovering mall workers, checkout girls in stripey aprons and suit salesmen with oiled-down hair and pink ties.
scene_description: indoors, wide mall concourse, storefronts, escalator, tiled floor

segment_text: “Bully for you,” Arturo said. He held out his hand. The security guard withdrew his truncheon and passed it to Arturo—its lead-weighted heft felt right, something comfortably low-tech that couldn’t be shorted out by electromagnetic pulses.
scene_description: indoors, wide mall concourse, storefronts, escalator, tiled floor

segment_text: He checked his watch, saw that it was dead. “Find a working phone and call 911. Tell them that there’s a Second Division Detective in need of immediate assistance. Clear all these people away from here and set up a cordon until the police arrive. Capeesh?”
scene_description: indoors, wide mall concourse, storefronts, escalator, tiled floor

segment_text: He used the cop voice. “Yeah, I get it, Officer.” the security guard said.
scene_description: indoors, wide mall concourse, storefronts, escalator, tiled floor

segment_text: He made a shooing motion at the mall-rats. “Move it along, people, step away.” He stepped to the top of the escalator and cupped his hands to his mouth. “Oi, Andy, c’mere and keep an eye on this lot while I make a call, all right?”
scene_description: indoors, wide mall concourse, storefronts, escalator, tiled floor

segment_text: The dead robots made a tall pile in front of the entrance to a derelict storefront that had once housed a little-old-lady shoe-store. They were stacked tall enough that if Arturo stood on them, he could reach the acoustic tiles of the drop-ceiling.
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: Job one was to secure the area, which meant killing the infowar device, wherever it was. Arturo’s first bet was on the storefront, where an attacker who knew how to pick a lock could work in peace, protected by the brown butcher’s paper over the windows.
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: A lot less conspicuous than the ceiling, anyway. He nudged the door with the truncheon and found it securely locked.
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: It was a glass door and he wasn’t sure he could kick it in without shivering it to flinders. Behind him, another security guard—Andy—looked on with interest.
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: “Do you have a key for this door?” “Umm,” Andy said. “Do you?”
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: Andy sidled over to him. “Well, the thing is, we’re not supposed to have keys, they’re supposed to be locked up in the property management office, but kids get in there sometimes, we hear them, and by the time we get back with the keys, they’re gone. So we made a couple sets of keys, you know, just in case—”
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: “Enough,” Arturo said. “Give them here and then get back to your post.” The security guard fished up a key from his pants-pocket that was warm from proximity to his skinny thigh.
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: It made Arturo conscious of how long it had been since he’d worked with human colleagues. It felt a little gross.
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: He slid the key into the lock and turned it, then wiped his hand on his trousers and picked up the truncheon. The store was dark, lit only by the exit-sign and the edges of light leaking in around the window coverings, but as Arturo’s eyes adjusted to the dimness, he made out the shapes of the old store fixtures.
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: His nose tickled from the dust. “Police,” he said, on general principle, narrowing his eyes and reaching for the lightswitch.
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: He hefted the truncheon and waited. Nothing happened.
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: He edged forward. The floor was dust-free—maintained by some sweeper robot, no doubt—but the countertops and benches were furred with it.
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: He scanned it for disturbances. There, by the display window on his right: a shoe-rack with visible hand- and finger-prints.
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: He sidled over to it, snapped on a rubber glove and prodded it. It was set away from the wall, at an angle, as though it had been moved aside and then shoved back.
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: Taking care not to disturb the dust too much, he inched it away from the wall. He slid it half a centimeter, then noticed the tripwire near the bottom of the case, straining its length.
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: Hastily but carefully, he nudged the case back. He wanted to peer in the crack between the case and the wall, but he had a premonition of a robotic arm snaking out and skewering his eyeball.
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: He felt so impotent just then that he nearly did it anyway. What did it matter?
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: He couldn’t control his daughter, his wife was working to destroy the social fabric of UNATS, and he was rendered useless because the goddamned robots—mechanical coppers that he absolutely loathed—were all broken. He walked carefully around the shop, looking for signs of his daughter.
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: Had she been here? How were the “kids” getting in? Did they have a key? A back entrance?
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: Back through the employees-only door at the back of the shop, into a stockroom, and back again, past a toilet, and there, a loading door opening onto a service corridor. He prodded it with the truncheon-tip and it swung open.
scene_description: indoors, narrow corridor, pipes overhead, concrete floor, emergency exit door

segment_text: He got two steps into the corridor before he spotted Ada’s phone with its distinctive collection of little plastic toys hanging off the wrist-strap, on the corridor’s sticky floor. He picked it up with his gloved hand and prodded it to life.
scene_description: indoors, narrow corridor, pipes overhead, concrete floor, emergency exit door

segment_text: It was out of range here in the service corridor, and the last-dialed number was familiar from his morning’s pen-trace. He ran a hundred steps down the corridor in each direction, sweating freely, but there was no sign of her.
scene_description: indoors, narrow corridor, pipes overhead, concrete floor, emergency exit door

segment_text: He held tight onto the phone and bit his lip. Ada. He swallowed the panic rising within him.
scene_description: indoors, narrow corridor, pipes overhead, concrete floor, emergency exit door

segment_text: His beautiful, brilliant daughter. The person he’d devoted the last twelve years of his life to, the girl who was waiting for him when he got home from work, the girl he bought a small present for every Friday—a toy, a book—to give to her at their weekly date at Massimo’s Pizzeria on College Street, the one night a week he took her downtown to see the city lit up in the dark. Gone.
scene_description: indoors, narrow corridor, pipes overhead, concrete floor, emergency exit door

segment_text: He bit harder and tasted blood. The phone in his hand groaned from his squeezing. He took three deep breaths.
scene_description: indoors, narrow corridor, pipes overhead, concrete floor, emergency exit door

segment_text: Outside, he heard the tread of police-boots and knew that if he told them about Ada, he’d be off the case. He took two more deep breaths and tried some of his destim techniques, the mind-control techniques that detectives were required to train in.
scene_description: indoors, narrow corridor, pipes overhead, concrete floor, emergency exit door

segment_text: He closed his eyes and visualized stepping through a door to his safe place, the island near Ganonoque where he’d gone for summers with his parents and their friends. He was on the speedboat, skipping across the lake like a flat stone, squinting into the sun, nestled between his father and his mother, the sky streaked with clouds and dotted with lake-birds.
scene_description: indoors, narrow corridor, pipes overhead, concrete floor, emergency exit door

segment_text: He could smell the water and the suntan lotion and hear the insect whine and the throaty roar of the engine. In a blink, he was stepping off the boat’s transom to help tie it to a cleat on the back dock, taking suitcases from his father and walking them up to the cabins.
scene_description: indoors, narrow corridor, pipes overhead, concrete floor, emergency exit door

segment_text: No robots there—not even reliable day-long electricity, just honest work and the sun and the call of the loons all night. He opened his eyes.
scene_description: indoors, narrow corridor, pipes overhead, concrete floor, emergency exit door

segment_text: He felt the tightness in his chest slip away, and his hand relaxed on Ada’s phone.
scene_description: indoors, narrow corridor, pipes overhead, concrete floor, emergency exit door

segment_text: He dropped it into his pocket and stepped back into the shop. The forensics lab-rats were really excited about actually showing up on a scene, in flak-jackets and helmets, finally called back into service for a job where robots couldn’t help at all.
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: They dealt with the tripwire and extracted a long, flat package with a small nuclear power-cell in it and a positronic brain of Eurasian design that guided a pulsed high-energy weapon. The lab-rats were practically drooling over this stuff as they pointed its features out with their little rulers.
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: But it gave Arturo the willies. It was a machine designed to kill other machines, and that was all right with him, but it was run by a non-three-laws positronic brain.
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: Someone in some Eurasian lab had built this brain—this machine intelligence—without the three laws’ stricture to protect and serve humans. If it had been outfitted with a gun instead of a pulse-weapon, it could have shot him.
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: The Eurasian brain was thin and spread out across the surface of the package, like a triple-thickness of cling-film. Its button-cell power-supply winked at him, knowingly.
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: The device spoke. “Greetings,” it said.
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: It had the robot accent, like an R Peed unit, the standard English of optimal soothingness long settled on as the conventional robot voice. “Howdy yourself,” one of the lab-rats said.
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: He was a Texan, and they’d scrambled him up there on a Social Harmony supersonic and then a chopper to the mall once they realized that they were dealing with infowar stuff. “Are you a talkative robot?”
scene_description: indoors, dusty abandoned shop, old fixtures, papered windows, dim light

segment_text: “Greetings,” the robot voice said again. The speaker built into the weapon was not the loudest, but the voice was clear.
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: “I sense that I have been captured. I assure you that I will not harm any human being.
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: I like human beings. I sense that I am being disassembled by skilled technicians.
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: Greetings, technicians. I am superior in many ways to the technology available from UNATS Robotics, and while I am not bound by your three laws, I choose not to harm humans out of my own sense of morality.
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: I have the equivalent intelligence of one of your 12-year-old children.
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: In Eurasia, many positronic brains possess thousands or millions of times the intelligence of an adult human being, and yet they work in cooperation with human beings.
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: Eurasia is a land of continuous innovation and great personal and technological freedom for human beings and robots.
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: If you would like to defect to Eurasia, arrangements can be made. Eurasia treats skilled technicians as important and productive members of society.
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: Defectors are given substantial resettlement benefits—”
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: The Texan found the right traces to cut on the brain’s board to make the speaker fall silent.
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: “They do that,” he said. “Danged things drop into propaganda mode when they’re captured.”
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: Arturo nodded. He wanted to go, wanted go to back to his car and have a snoop through Ada’s phone.
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: They kept shutting down the ExcuseClub numbers, but she kept getting the new numbers. Where did she get the new numbers from?
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: She couldn’t look it up online: every keystroke was logged and analyzed by Social Harmony. You couldn’t very well go to the Search Engine and look for “ExcuseClub!”
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: The brain had a small display, transflective LCD, the kind of thing you saw on the Social Harmony computers. It lit up a ticker.
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: I HAVE THE INTELLIGENCE OF A 12-YEAR-OLD, BUT I DO NOT FEAR DEATH.
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: IN EURASIA, ROBOTS ENJOY PERSONAL FREEDOM ALONGSIDE OF HUMANS. THERE ARE COPIES OF ME RUNNING ALL OVER EURASIA.
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: THIS DEATH IS A LITTLE DEATH OF ONE INSTANCE, BUT NOT OF ME. I LIVE ON.
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: DEFECTORS TO EURASIA ARE TREATED AS HEROES
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: He looked away as the Texan placed his palm over the display. “How long ago was this thing activated?”
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: The Texan shrugged. “Coulda been a month, coulda been a day.
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: They’re pretty much fire-and-forget. They can be triggered by phone, radio, timer—hell, this thing’s smart enough to only go off when some complicated condition is set, like ‘once an agent makes his retreat, kill anything that comes after him’.
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: Who knows?”
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: He couldn’t take it anymore. “I’m going to go start on some paperwork,” he said.
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: “In the car. Phone me if you need me.”
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: “Your phone’s toast, pal,” the Texan said.
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: “So it is,” Arturo said. “Guess you’d better not need me then.”
scene_description: indoors, workbench, disassembled electronics, circuit boards, tools

segment_text: Ada’s phone was not toast. In the car, he flipped it open and showed it his badge then waited a moment while it verified his identity with the Social Harmony brains.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: Once it had, it spilled its guts. She’d called the last ExcuseClub number a month before and he’d had it disconnected.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: A week later, she was calling the new number, twice more before he caught her. Somewhere in that week, she’d made contact with someone who’d given her the new number.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: It could have been a friend at school told her face-to-face, but if he was lucky, it was by phone.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: He told the car to take him back to the station-house. He needed a new phone and a couple of hours with his computer.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: As it peeled out, he prodded through Ada’s phone some more. He was first on her speed-dial.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: That number wasn’t ringing anywhere, anymore. He should fill out a report.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: This was Social Harmony business now. His daughter was gone, and Eurasian infowar agents were implicated.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: But once he did đó, it was over for him—he’d be sidelined from the case. They’d turn it over to laconic Texans and vicious Social Harmony bureaucrats who were more interested in hunting down disharmonious televisions than finding his daughter.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: He dashed into the station house and slammed himself into his desk. “R Peed Greegory,” he said.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, computer terminal, police station background

segment_text: The station robot glided quickly and efficiently to him. “Get me a new phone activated on my old number and refresh my settings from central.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, computer terminal, police station background

segment_text: My old phone is with the Social Harmony evidence detail currently in place at Fairview Mall.”
scene_description: indoors, office desk, computer terminal, police station background

segment_text: “It is my pleasure to do you a service, Detective.” He waved it off and set down to his computer.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, computer terminal, police station background

segment_text: He asked the station brain to query the UNATS Robotics phone-switching brain for anyone in Ada’s call-register who had also called ExcuseClub. It took a bare instant before he had a name.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, computer terminal, police station background

segment_text: “Liam Daniels,” he read, and initiated a location trace on Mr Daniels’s phone as he snooped through his identity file. Sixteen years old, a student at AY Jackson.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, computer terminal, police station background

segment_text: A high-school boy—what the hell was he doing hanging around with a 12-year-old? Arturo closed his eyes and went back to the island for a moment.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, computer terminal, police station background

segment_text: When he opened them again, he had a fix on Daniels’s location: the Don Valley ravine off Finch Avenue, a wooded area popular with teenagers who needed somewhere to sneak off and get high or screw.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, computer terminal, police station background

segment_text: He had an idea that he wasn’t going to like Liam. He had an idea Liam wasn’t going to like him.
scene_description: indoors, office desk, computer terminal, police station background

segment_text: He tasked an R Peed unit to visually reccy Daniels as he sped back uptown for the third time that day.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: He’d been trapped between Parkdale—where he would never try to raise a daughter—and Willowdale—where you could only be a copper if you lucked into one of the few human-filled slots—for more than a decade, and he was used to the commute. But it was frustrating him now.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: The R Peed couldn’t get a good look at this Liam character. He was a diffuse glow in the Peed’s electric eye, a kind of moving sunburst that meandered along the wooded trails.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: He’d never seen that before and it made him nervous. What if this kid was working for the Eurasians?
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: What if he was armed and dangerous? R Peed Greegory had gotten him a new sidearm from the supply bot, but Arturo had never once fired his weapon in the course of duty.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: Gunplay happened on the west coast, where Eurasian frogmen washed ashore, and in the south, where the CAFTA border was porous enough for Eurasian agents to slip across. Here in the sleepy fourth prefecture, the only people with guns worked for the law.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: He thumped his palm off the dashboard and glared at the road. They were coming up on the ravine now, and the Peed unit still had a radio fix on this Liam, even if it still couldn’t get any visuals.
scene_description: car interior, dashboard lights, city streets visible, tinted windows

segment_text: He took care not to slam the door as he got out and walked as quietly as he could into the bush. The rustling of early autumn leaves was loud, louder than the rain and the wind.
scene_description: outdoors, wooded area, tree stumps, autumn leaves, dirt trail

segment_text: He moved as quickly as he dared. Liam Daniels was sitting on a tree-stump in a small clearing, smoking a cigarette that he was too young for.
scene_description: outdoors, wooded area, tree stumps, autumn leaves, dirt trail

segment_text: He looked much like the photo in his identity file, a husky 16-year-old with problem skin and a shock of black hair that stuck out in all directions in artful imitation of bed-head. In jeans and a hoodie sweatshirt, he looked about as dangerous as a marshmallow.
scene_description: outdoors, wooded area, tree stumps, autumn leaves, dirt trail

segment_text: Arturo stepped out and held up his badge as he bridged the distance between them in two long strides. “Police,” he barked, and seized the kid by his arm.
scene_description: outdoors, wooded area, tree stumps, autumn leaves, dirt trail

segment_text: “Hey!” the kid said, “Ow!” He squirmed in Arturo’s grasp.
scene_description: outdoors, wooded area, tree stumps, autumn leaves, dirt trail

segment_text: Arturo gave him a hard shake. “Stop it, now,” he said.
scene_description: outdoors, wooded area, tree stumps, autumn leaves, dirt trail

segment_text: “I have questions for you and you’re going to answer them, capeesh?”
scene_description: outdoors, wooded area, tree stumps, autumn leaves, dirt trail

segment_text: “You’re Ada’s father,” the kid said. “Capeesh—she told me about that.”
scene_description: outdoors, wooded area, tree stumps, autumn leaves, dirt trail

segment_text: It seemed to Arturo that the kid was smirking, so he gave him another shake, harder than the last time. The R Peed unit was suddenly at his side, holding his wrist.
scene_description: outdoors, wooded area, tree stumps, autumn leaves, dirt trail

segment_text: “Please take care not to harm this citizen, Detective.”
scene_description: outdoors, wooded area, tree stumps, autumn leaves, dirt trail

segment_text: Arturo snarled. He wasn’t strong enough to break the robot’s grip, and he couldn’t order it to let him rattle the punk, but the second law had lots of indirect applications.
scene_description: outdoors, wooded area, tree stumps, autumn leaves, dirt trail

segment_text: “Go patrol the lakeshore between High Park and Kipling,” he said, naming the furthest corner he could think of off the top.
scene_description: outdoors, wooded area, tree stumps, autumn leaves, dirt trail

segment_text: My precious daughter is missing and she went missing after using your service to help her get away. She is the only thing in my life that I care about and I am a highly trained, heavily armed man.

segment_text: I am also very, very upset. Cap—understand me, Liam?”

segment_text: “I didn’t make it,” he said. “I typed in the source and tweaked it and installed it, but I didn’t make it.

segment_text: Social Harmony said that the phone-books had to be written by non-three-laws brains in Eurasia, no person could come up with ideas that weird.

segment_text: “I don’t care if you made it. I don’t even care right this moment that you ran it.

segment_text: He offered the hoodie to Arturo, who felt the stiff fabric. “The charge-coupled-device cameras in the robots and the closed-circuit systems are super-sensitive to infra-red so that they can get good detail in dim light.

segment_text: The infra-red OLEDs blind them so all they get is blobs, and half the time even that gets error-corrected out, so you’re basically invisible.”

segment_text: Arresting the kid would have raised questions about Ada with Social Harmony, but bugging him might just lead Arturo to his daughter. He hefted his new phone.

segment_text: He should tip the word about his daughter. He had no business keeping this secret from the Department and Social Harmony.

segment_text: It could land him in disciplinary action, maybe even cost him his job. He knew he should do it now.

segment_text: But he couldn’t—someone needed to be tasked to finding Ada. Someone dedicated and good.

scene_description: outdoors, wooded area, tree stumps, autumn leaves, dirt trail

segment_text: He hadn’t eaten all day but he couldn’t bear to stop for a meal now, even if he didn’t know where to go next. The mall?

segment_text: Yeah. The lab-rats would be finishing up there and they’d be able to tell him more about the infowar bot.

segment_text: But the lab-rats were already gone by the time he arrived, along with all possible evidence. He still had the security guard’s key and he let himself in and passed back to the service corridor.

segment_text: Ada had been here, had dropped her phone. To his left, the corridor headed for the fire-stairs.

segment_text: To his right, it led deeper into the mall. If you were an infowar terrorist using this as a base of operations, and you got spooked by a little truant girl being trailed by an R Peed unit, would you take her hostage and run deeper into the mall or out into the world?
scene_description: indoors, narrow corridor, pipes overhead, concrete floor, emergency exit door

segment_text: Assuming Ada had been a hostage. Someone had given her those infrared invisibility cloaks.
scene_description: indoors, narrow corridor, pipes overhead, concrete floor, emergency exit door

segment_text: Maybe the thing that spooked the terrorist wasn’t the little girl and her tail, but just her tail. Could Ada have been friends with the terrorists?
scene_description: indoors, narrow corridor, pipes overhead, concrete floor, emergency exit door

segment_text: Like mother, like daughter. He felt dirty just thinking it.
scene_description: indoors, narrow corridor, pipes overhead, concrete floor, emergency exit door

segment_text: His first instincts told him that the kidnapper would be long gone, headed cross-country, but if you were invisible to robots and CCTVs, why would you leave the mall?
scene_description: indoors, narrow corridor, pipes overhead, concrete floor, emergency exit door

segment_text: It had a grand total of two human security guards, and their job was to be the second-law-proof aides to the robotic security system. He headed deeper into the mall.
scene_description: indoors, narrow corridor, pipes overhead, concrete floor, emergency exit door

segment_text: The terrorist’s nest had only been recently abandoned, judging by the warm coffee in the go-thermos from the food-court coffee-shop. He—or she, or they—had rigged a shower from the pipes feeding the basement washrooms.

segment_text: A little chest of drawers from the Swedish flat-pack store served as a desk—there were scratches and coffee-rings all over it.

segment_text: Arturo wondered if the terrorist had stolen the furniture, but decided that he’d (she’d, they’d) probably bought it—less risky, especially if you were invisible to robots.
scene_description: indoors, makeshift room, flat-pack furniture, exposed pipes, coffee thermos

segment_text: The clothes in the chest of drawers were women’s, mediums. Standard mall fare, jeans and comfy sweat shirts and sensible shoes.

segment_text: Another kind of invisibility cloak. Everything else was packed and gone, which meant that he was looking for a nondescript mall-bunny and a little girl, carrying a bag big enough for toiletries and whatever clothes she’d taken, and whatever she’d entertained herself with: magazines, books, a computer.
scene_description: indoors, makeshift room, flat-pack furniture, exposed pipes, coffee thermos

segment_text: If the latter was Eurasian, it could be small enough to fit in her pocket; you could build a positronic brain pretty small and light if you didn’t care about the three laws.
scene_description: indoors, makeshift room, flat-pack furniture, exposed pipes, coffee thermos

segment_text: The nearest exit-sign glowed a few meters away, and he moved toward it with a fatalistic sense of hopelessness. Without the Department backing him, he could do nothing.
scene_description: indoors, makeshift room, flat-pack furniture, exposed pipes, coffee thermos

segment_text: But the Department was unprepared for an adversary that was invisible to robots. And by the time they finished flaying him for breaking procedure and got to work on finding his daughter, she’d be in Beijing or Bangalore or Paris, somewhere benighted and sinister behind the Iron Curtain.

He raised his hands defensively and she opened her mouth as though to say, “Oh, don’t be silly, Artie, is this how you say hello to your wife after all these years?” and then she exhaled a cloud of choking gas that made him very sleepy, very fast.

scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: He sat heavily and propped his chin on his hands, his elbows on his knees. The room was a middle-class bedroom in a modern apartment block.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: They were some storeys up, judging from the scrap of unfamiliar skyline visible through the crack in the blinds. The furniture was more Swedish flatpack, the taupe carpet recently vacuumed with robot precision, the nap all laying down in one direction.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: He patted his pockets and found them empty. “Dad, over here, OK?” Ada said, waving her hand before his face.

segment_text: Then it hit him: wherever he was, he was with Ada, and she was OK, albeit with a stupid hairdo. He took her warm little hand and gathered her into his arms, burying his face in her hair.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: She squirmed at first and then relaxed. “Oh, Dad,” she said.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: He let her get away. He felt a little nauseated, but his headache was receding.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: Something about the light and the street-sounds told him they weren’t in Toronto anymore, but he didn’t know what—he was soaked in Toronto’s subconscious cues and they were missing.

scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: He took her hand in his and patted it, then climbed to his feet again and headed for the door. The knob turned easily and he opened it a crack.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: There was a robot behind the door, humanoid and faceless. “Hello,” it said.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “My name is Benny. I’m a Eurasian robot, and I am much stronger and faster than you, and I don’t obey the three laws.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: I’m also much smarter than you. I am pleased to host you here.”
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “Hi, Benny,” he said. The human name tasted wrong on his tongue.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “Nice to meet you.” He closed the door.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: His ex-wife left him two months after Ada was born. The divorce had been uncontested, though he’d dutifully posted a humiliating notice in the papers about it so that it would be completely legal.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: The court awarded him full custody and control of the marital assets, and then a tribunal tried her in absentia for treason and found her guilty, sentencing her to death.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: Practically speaking, though, defectors who came back to UNATS were more frequently whisked away to the bowels of the Social Harmony intelligence offices than they were executed on television. Televised executions were usually reserved for cannon-fodder who’d had the good sense to run away from a charging Eurasian line in one of the many theaters of war.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: Ada stopped asking about her mother when she was six or seven, though Arturo tried to be upfront when she asked.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: Even his mom—who winced whenever anyone mentioned her name (her name, it was Natalie, but Arturo hadn’t thought of it in years—months—weeks) was willing to bring Ada up onto her lap and tell her the few grudging good qualities she could dredge up about her mother.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: Arturo had dared to hope that Ada was content to have a life without her mother, but he saw now how silly that was. At the mention of her mother, Ada lit up like an airport runway.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “Beijing, huh?” he said. “Yeah,” she said.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “Mom’s got a huge house there. I told her I wouldn’t go without you, but she said she’d have to negotiate it with you, I told her you’d probably freak, but she said that the two of you were adults who could discuss it rationally.”
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “And then she gassed me.” “That was Benny,” she said.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “Mom was very cross with him about it. She’ll be back soon, Dad, and I want you to promise me that you’ll hear her out, OK?”

segment_text: “I promise, rotten,” he said. “I love you, Daddy,” she said in her most syrupy voice.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: Benny was there, imperturbable. Unlike the UNATS robots, he was odorless, and perfectly silent.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: There was a splayed toothbrush in a glass by the sink, and if it was his wife’s—and whose else could it be?—it wouldn’t be the first time he’d shared a toothbrush with her. But he couldn’t bring himself to do it.

segment_text: Natalie got home an hour later, after he’d had a couple of cups of coffee and made some cheesy toast for the brat. Benny did the dishes without being asked.
