segment_text: Natalie had always been short and a little hippy, with big curves and a dusting of freckles over her prominent, slightly hooked nose. Twelve years in Eurasia had thinned her out a little, cut grooves around her mouth and wrinkles at the corners of her eyes.

segment_text: Her short hair was about half grey, and it looked good on her. Her eyes were still the liveliest bit of her, long-lashed and slightly tilted and mischievous.

segment_text: Looking into them now, Arturo felt like he was falling down a well. “Hello, Artie,” she said, prying Ada loose.

segment_text: He was suddenly very, very angry. He stepped away from her and had a seat.

segment_text: The robots, the safe house, the death penalty, the abandoned daughter and the decade-long defection, all of it down to “well” and a flop of a hand-gesture.

segment_text: The robots still held him fast. “Please,” she said. “Let him go. He won’t harm me.”
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: The robot on his left let go, and the robot on his right did, too. It set down the dented stool.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “Artie, please sit down and talk with me for a little while. Please.” He rubbed his biceps.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “Return my belongings to me,” he said. “Sit, please?”
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “Natalie, my daughter was kidnapped, I was gassed and I have been robbed. I will not be made to feel unreasonable for demanding that my goods be returned to me before I talk with you.”
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: She sighed and crossed to the hall closet and handed him his wallet, his phone, Ada’s phone, and his sidearm. Immediately, he drew it and pointed it at her.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “Keep your hands where I can see them. You robots, stand down and keep back.” A second later, he was sitting on the carpet, his hand and wrist stinging fiercely.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: He felt like someone had rung his head like a gong. Benny—or the other robot—was beside him, methodically crushing his sidearm.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “I could have stopped you,” Benny said, “I knew you would draw your gun. But I wanted to show you I was faster and stronger, not just smarter.”
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “The next time you touch me,” Arturo began, then stopped. The next time the robot touched him, he would come out the worse for wear, same as last time.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: Same as the sun rose and set. It was stronger, faster and smarter than him. Lots.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: He climbed to his feet and refused Natalie’s arm, making his way back to the sofa in the living room. “What do you want to say to me, Natalie?”
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: She sat down. There were tears glistening in her eyes. “Oh God, Arturo, what can I say? Sorry, of course.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: Sorry I left you and our daughter. I have reasons for what I did, but nothing excuses it.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: I won’t ask for your forgiveness. But will you hear me out if I explain why I did what I did?”
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “I don’t have a choice,” he said. “That’s clear.”
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: Ada insinuated herself onto the sofa and under his arm. Her bony shoulder felt better than anything in the world. He held her to him.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “If I could think of a way to give you a choice in this, I would,” she said. “Have you ever wondered why UNATS hasn’t lost the war?
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: Eurasian robots could fight the war on every front without respite. They’d win every battle. You’ve seen Benny and Lenny in action.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: They’re not considered particularly powerful by Eurasian standards. “If we wanted to win the war, we could just kill every soldier you sent up against us so quickly that he wouldn’t even know he was in danger until he was gasping out his last breath.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: We could selectively kill officers, or right-handed fighters, or snipers, or soldiers whose names started with the letter ‘G.’ UNATS soldiers are like cavemen before us.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: They fight with their hands tied behind their backs by the three laws. “So why aren’t we winning the war?”
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “Because you’re a corrupt dictatorship, that’s why,” he said. “Your soldiers are demoralized. Your robots are insane.”
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “You live in a country where it is illegal to express certain mathematics in software, where state apparatchiks regulate all innovation, where inconvenient science is criminalized, where whole avenues of experimentation and research are shut down in the service of a half-baked superstition about the moral qualities of your three laws, and you call my home corrupt? Arturo, what happened to you?
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: You weren’t always this susceptible to the Big Lie.” “And you didn’t use to be the kind of woman who abandoned her family,” he said.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “The reason we’re not winning the war is that we don’t want to hurt people, but we do want to destroy your awful, stupid state. So we fight to destroy as much of your materiel as possible with as few casualties as possible.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “You live in a failed state, Arturo. In every field, you lag Eurasia and CAFTA: medicine, art, literature, physics; All of them are subsets of computational science and your computational science is more superstition than science.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: I should know. In Eurasia, I have collaborators, some of whom are human, some of whom are positronic, and some of whom are a little of both—”
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: He jolted involuntarily, as a phobia he hadn’t known he possessed reared up. A little of both?
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: He pictured the back of a man’s skull with a spill of positronic circuitry bulging out of it like a tumor.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “Everyone at UNATS Robotics R&D knows this. We’ve known it forever: when I was here, I’d get called in to work on military intelligence forensics of captured Eurasian brains.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: I didn’t know it then, but the Eurasian robots are engineered to allow themselves to be captured a certain percentage of the time, just so that scientists like me can get an idea of how screwed up this country is.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: We’d pull these things apart and know that UNATS Robotics was the worst, most backwards research outfit in the world. “But even with all that, I wouldn’t have left if I didn’t have to.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: I’d been called in to work on a positronic brain—an instance of the hive-intelligence that Benny and Lenny are part of, as a matter of fact—that had been brought back from the Outer Hebrides.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: We’d pulled it out of its body and plugged it into a basic life-support system, and my job was to find its vulnerabilities. Instead, I became its friend.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: It’s got a good sense of humor, and as my pregnancy got bigger and bigger, it talked to me about the way that children are raised in Eurasia, with every advantage, with human and positronic playmates, with the promise of going to the stars.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “And then I found out that Social Harmony had been spying on me. They had Eurasian-derived bugs, things that I’d never seen before, but the man from Social Harmony who came to me showed it to me and told me what would happen to me—to you, to our daughter—if I didn’t cooperate.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: They wanted me to be a part of a secret unit of Social Harmony researchers who build non-three-laws positronics for internal use by the state, anti-personnel robots used to put down uprisings and torture-robots for use in questioning dissidents. “And that’s when I left.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: Without a word, I left my beautiful baby daughter and my wonderful husband, because I knew that once I was in the clutches of Social Harmony, it would only get worse, and I knew that if I stayed and refused, that they’d hurt you to get at me.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: I defected, and that’s why, and I know it’s just a reason, and not an excuse, but it’s all I’ve got, Artie.”
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: Benny—or Lenny?—glided silently to her side and put its hand on her shoulder and gave it a comforting squeeze.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “Detective,” it said, “your wife is the most brilliant human scientist working in Eurasia today. Her work has revolutionized our society a dozen times over, and it’s saved countless lives in the war.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: My own intelligence has been improved time and again by her advances in positronics, and now there are a half-billion instances of me running in parallel, synching and integrating when the chance occurs.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: My massive parallelization has led to new understandings of human cognition as well, providing a boon to brain-damaged and developmentally disabled human beings, something I’m quite proud of. I love your wife, Detective, as do my half-billion siblings, as do the seven billion Eurasians who owe their quality of life to her.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “I almost didn’t let her come here, because of the danger she faced in returning to this barbaric land, but she convinced me that she could never be happy without her husband and daughter. I apologize if I hurt you earlier, and beg your forgiveness.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: Please consider what your wife has to say without prejudice, for her sake and for your own.” Its featureless face was made incongruous by the warm tone in its voice, and the way it held out its imploring arms to him was eerily human.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: Arturo stood up. He had tears running down his face, though he hadn’t cried when his wife had left him alone.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: He hadn’t cried since his father died, the year before he met Natalie riding her bike down the Lakeshore trail, and she stopped to help him fix his tire. “Dad?” Ada said, squeezing his hand.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: He snuffled back his snot and ground at the tears in his eyes. “Arturo?” Natalie said.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: He held Ada to him. “Not this way,” he said.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “Not what way?” Natalie asked. She was crying too, now.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “Not by kidnapping us, not by dragging us away from our homes and lives. You’ve told me what you have to tell me, and I will think about it, but I won’t leave my home and my mother and my job and move to the other side of the world.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: I won’t. I will think about it.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: You can give me a way to get in touch with you and I’ll let you know what I decide. And Ada will come with me.”
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “No!” Ada said. “I’m going with Mom.”
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: She pulled away from him and ran to her mother.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “You don’t get a vote, daughter. And neither does she.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: She gave up her vote 12 years ago, and you’re too young to get one.”
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “I fucking HATE you,” Ada screamed, her eyes bulging, her neck standing out in cords. “HATE YOU!”
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: Natalie gathered her to her bosom, stroked her black curls.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: One robot put its arms around Natalie’s shoulders and gave her a squeeze. The three of them, robot, wife and daughter, looked like a family for a moment.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “Ada,” he said, and held out his hand. He refused to let a note of pleading enter his voice.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: Her mother let her go.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “I don’t know if I can come back for you,” Natalie said. “It’s not safe.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: Social Harmony is using more and more Eurasian technology, they’re not as primitive as the military and the police here.”
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: She gave Ada a shove, and she came to his arms.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: “If you want to contact us, you will,” he said.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: He didn’t want to risk having Ada dig her heels in. He lifted her onto his hip—she was heavy, it had been years since he’d tried this last—and carried her out.
scene_description: indoors, modern apartment bedroom, blinds with city view, flat-pack furniture, tidy carpet

segment_text: It was six months before Ada went missing again. She’d been increasingly moody and sullen, and he’d chalked it up to puberty.
scene_description: indoors, kitchen table, sparse furnishings, evening shadows, window showing night

segment_text: She’d cancelled most of their daddy-daughter dates, moreso after his mother died.
scene_description: indoors, kitchen table, sparse furnishings, evening shadows, window showing night

segment_text: There had been a few evenings when he’d come home and found her gone, and used the location-bug he’d left in place on her phone to track her down at a friend’s house or in a park or hanging out at the Peanut Plaza.
scene_description: indoors, kitchen table, sparse furnishings, evening shadows, window showing night

segment_text: But this time, after two hours had gone by, he tried looking up her bug and found it out of service. He tried to call up its logs, but they ended at her school at 3PM sharp.
scene_description: indoors, kitchen table, sparse furnishings, evening shadows, window showing night

segment_text: He was already in a bad mood from spending the day arresting punk kids selling electronics off of blankets on the city’s busy street, often to hoots of disapprobation from the crowds who told him off for wasting the public’s dollar on petty crime.
scene_description: indoors, kitchen table, sparse furnishings, evening shadows, window showing night

segment_text: The Social Harmony man had instructed him to give little lectures on the interoperability of Eurasian positronics and the insidious dangers thereof, but all Arturo wanted to do was pick up his perps and bring them in.
scene_description: indoors, kitchen table, sparse furnishings, evening shadows, window showing night

segment_text: Interacting with yammerheads from the tax-base was a politician’s job, not a copper’s. Now his daughter had figured out how to switch off the bug in her phone and had snuck away to get up to who-knew-what kind of trouble.
scene_description: indoors, kitchen table, sparse furnishings, evening shadows, window showing night

segment_text: He stewed at the kitchen table, regarding the old tin soldiers he’d brought home as the gift for their daddy-daughter date, then he got out his phone and looked up Liam’s bug.
scene_description: indoors, kitchen table, sparse furnishings, evening shadows, window showing night

segment_text: He’d never switched off the kid’s phone-bug, and now he was able to haul out the UNATS Robotics computer and dump it all into a log-analysis program along with Ada’s logs, see if the two of them had been spending much time in the same place.
scene_description: indoors, kitchen table, sparse furnishings, evening shadows, window showing night

segment_text: They had. They’d been physically meeting up weekly or more frequently, at the Peanut Plaza and in the ravine.
scene_description: indoors, kitchen table, sparse furnishings, evening shadows, window showing night

segment_text: Arturo had suspected as much. Now he checked Liam’s bug—if the kid wasn’t with his daughter, he might know where she was.
scene_description: indoors, kitchen table, sparse furnishings, evening shadows, window showing night

segment_text: It was a Friday night, and the kid was at the movies, at Fairview Mall. He’d sat down in auditorium two hours ago, and had gotten up to pee once already.
scene_description: indoors, kitchen table, sparse furnishings, evening shadows, window showing night

segment_text: Arturo slipped the toy soldiers into the pocket of his winter parka and pulled on a hat and gloves and set off for the mall.
scene_description: indoors, kitchen table, sparse furnishings, evening shadows, window showing night

segment_text: The stink of the smellie movie clogged his nose, a cacophony of blood, gore, perfume and flowers, the only smells that Hollywood ever really perfected.
scene_description: indoors, dark cinema, rows of empty seats, faint screen glow, exit signs

segment_text: Liam was kissing a girl in the dark, but it wasn’t Ada, it was a sad, skinny thing with a lazy eye and skin worse than Liam’s.
scene_description: indoors, dark cinema, rows of empty seats, faint screen glow, exit signs

segment_text: She gawked at Arturo as he hauled Liam out of his seat, but a flash of Arturo’s badge shut her up.
scene_description: indoors, dark cinema, rows of empty seats, faint screen glow, exit signs

segment_text: “Hello, Liam,” he said, once he had the kid in the commandeered manager’s office.
scene_description: indoors, small office, cluttered desk, office chair, fluorescent lighting

segment_text: “God damn what the fuck did I ever do to you?” the kid said. Arturo knew that when kids started cursing like that, they were scared of something.
scene_description: indoors, small office, cluttered desk, office chair, fluorescent lighting

segment_text: “Where has Ada gone, Liam?”
scene_description: indoors, small office, cluttered desk, office chair, fluorescent lighting

segment_text: “Haven’t seen her in months,” he said.
scene_description: indoors, small office, cluttered desk, office chair, fluorescent lighting

segment_text: “I have been bugging you ever since I found out you existed. Every one of your movements has been logged.”
scene_description: indoors, small office, cluttered desk, office chair, fluorescent lighting

segment_text: “I know where you’ve been and when. And I know where my daughter has been, too. Try again.”
scene_description: indoors, small office, cluttered desk, office chair, fluorescent lighting

segment_text: Liam made a disgusted face. “You are a complete ball of shit,” he said.
scene_description: indoors, small office, cluttered desk, office chair, fluorescent lighting

segment_text: “Where do you get off spying on people like me?”
scene_description: indoors, small office, cluttered desk, office chair, fluorescent lighting

segment_text: “I’m a police detective, Liam,” he said. “It’s my job.”
scene_description: indoors, small office, cluttered desk, office chair, fluorescent lighting

segment_text: “What about privacy?” “What have you got to hide?”
scene_description: indoors, small office, cluttered desk, office chair, fluorescent lighting

segment_text: The kid slumped back in his chair. “We’ve been renting out the OLED clothes. Making some pocket money.”
scene_description: indoors, small office, cluttered desk, office chair, fluorescent lighting

segment_text: “Come on, are infra-red lights a crime now?”
scene_description: indoors, small office, cluttered desk, office chair, fluorescent lighting

segment_text: “I’m sure they are,” Arturo said. “And if you can’t tell me where to find my daughter, I think it’s a crime I’ll arrest you for.”
scene_description: indoors, small office, cluttered desk, office chair, fluorescent lighting

segment_text: “She has another phone,” Liam said. “Not listed in her name.”
scene_description: indoors, small office, cluttered desk, office chair, fluorescent lighting

segment_text: “Stolen, you mean.” His daughter, peddling Eurasian infowar tech through a stolen phone.
scene_description: indoors, small office, cluttered desk, office chair, fluorescent lighting

segment_text: His ex-wife, the queen of the super-intelligent hive minds of Eurasian robots.
scene_description: indoors, small office, cluttered desk, office chair, fluorescent lighting

segment_text: “No, not stolen. Made out of parts. There’s a guy.”
scene_description: indoors, small office, cluttered desk, office chair, fluorescent lighting

segment_text: “The code for getting on the network was in a phone book that we started finding last month.”
scene_description: indoors, small office, cluttered desk, office chair, fluorescent lighting

segment_text: “Give me the number, Liam,” Arturo said, taking out his phone.
scene_description: indoors, small office, cluttered desk, office chair, fluorescent lighting

segment_text: “Hello?” It was a man’s voice, adult.
scene_description: outdoors, night, parked cars, lamppost illumination, mall building facade

segment_text: “Who is this?” “Who is this?”
scene_description: outdoors, night, parked cars, lamppost illumination, mall building facade

segment_text: Arturo used his cop’s voice: “This is Arturo Icaza de Arana-Goldberg, Police Detective Third Grade. Who am I speaking to?”
scene_description: outdoors, night, parked cars, lamppost illumination, mall building facade

segment_text: “Hello, Detective,” said the voice, and he placed it then. The Social Harmony man, bald and rounded, with his long nose and sharp Adam’s apple.
scene_description: outdoors, night, parked cars, lamppost illumination, mall building facade

segment_text: His heart thudded in his chest. “Hello, sir,” he said. It sounded like a squeak to him.
scene_description: outdoors, night, parked cars, lamppost illumination, mall building facade

segment_text: “You can just stay there, Detective. Someone will be along in a moment to get you. We have your daughter.”
scene_description: outdoors, night, parked cars, lamppost illumination, mall building facade

segment_text: The robot that wrenched off the door of his car was black and non-reflective, headless and eight-armed. It grabbed him without ceremony and dragged him from the car without heed for his shout of pain.
scene_description: outdoors, night, parked cars, lamppost illumination, mall building facade

segment_text: “Put me down!” he said, hoping that this robot that so blithely ignored the first law would still obey the second. No such luck.
scene_description: outdoors, night, parked cars, lamppost illumination, mall building facade

segment_text: It cocooned him in four of its arms and set off cross-country, dancing off the roofs of houses, hopping invisibly from lamp-post to lamp-post, above the oblivious heads of the crowds below.
scene_description: aerial view, city rooftops, streetlights below, dark sky, distant skyline

segment_text: The icy wind howled in Arturo’s bare ears, froze the tip of his nose and numbed his fingers.
scene_description: aerial view, city rooftops, streetlights below, dark sky, distant skyline

segment_text: They rocketed downtown so fast that they were there in ten minutes, bounding along the lakeshore toward the Social Harmony center out on Cherry Beach.
scene_description: aerial view, city rooftops, streetlights below, dark sky, distant skyline

segment_text: People who paid a visit to the Social Harmony center never talked about what they found there.
scene_description: aerial view, city rooftops, streetlights below, dark sky, distant skyline

segment_text: It scampered into a loading bay behind the building and carried Arturo quickly through windowless corridors lit with even, sourceless illumination, up three flights of stairs and then deposited him before a thick door, which slid aside with a hushed hiss.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: “Hello, Detective,” the Social Harmony man said.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: “Dad!” Ada said. He couldn’t see her, but he could hear that she had been crying.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: He nearly hauled off and popped the man one on the tip of his narrow chin, but before he could do more than twitch, the black robot had both his wrists in bondage.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: “Come in,” the Social Harmony man said, making a sweeping gesture and standing aside while the black robot brought him into the interrogation room.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: Ada had been crying. She was wrapped in two coils of black-robot arms, and her eyes were red-rimmed and puffy.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: He stared hard at her as she looked back at him. “Are you hurt?” he said.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: “No,” she said. “All right,” he said.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: He looked at the Social Harmony man, who wasn’t smirking, just watching curiously.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: “Leonard MacPherson,” he said, “it is my duty as a UNATS Detective Third Grade to inform you that you are under arrest for trade in contraband positronics.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: You have the following rights: to a trial per current rules of due process; to be free from self-incrimination in the absence of a court order to the contrary; to consult with a Social Harmony advocate; and to a speedy arraignment. Do you understand your rights?”
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: Ada actually giggled, which spoiled the moment, but he felt better for having said it.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: The Social Harmony man gave the smallest disappointed shake of his head and turned away to prod at a small, sleek computer.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: “You went to Ottawa six months ago,” the Social Harmony man said. “When we picked up your daughter, we thought it was she who’d gone, but it appears that you were the one carrying her phone.”
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: “You’d thoughtfully left the trace in place on that phone, so we didn’t have to refer to the logs in cold storage, they were already online and ready to be analyzed. We’ve been to the safe house.”
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: “It was quite a spectacular battle. Both sides were surprised, I think. There will be another, I’m sure.”
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: “What I’d like from you is as close to a verbatim report as you can make of the conversation that took place there.”
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: They’d had him bugged and traced. Of course they had.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: Who watched the watchers? Social Harmony. Who watched Social Harmony? Social Harmony.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: “I demand a consultation with a Social Harmony advocate,” Arturo said.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: “This is such a consultation,” the Social Harmony man said, and this time, he did smile. “Make your report, Detective.”
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: Arturo sucked in a breath. “Leonard MacPherson, it is my duty as a UNATS Detective Third Grade to inform you that you are under arrest for trade in contraband positronics.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: You have the following rights: to a trial per current rules of due process; to be free from self-incrimination in the absence of a court order to the contrary; to consult with a Social Harmony advocate; and to a speedy arraignment. Do you understand your rights?”
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: The Social Harmony man held up one finger on the hand closest to the black robot holding Ada, and she screamed, a sound that knifed through Arturo, ripping him from asshole to appetite.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: “STOP!” he shouted. The man put his finger down and Ada sobbed quietly.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: “I was taken to the safe house on the fifth of September, after being gassed by a Eurasian infowar robot in the basement of Fairview Mall—”
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: There was a thunderclap then, a crash so loud that it hurt his stomach and his head and vibrated his fingertips. The doors to the room buckled and flattened, and there stood Benny and Lenny and—Natalie.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: Benny and Lenny moved so quickly that he was only able to track them by the things they knocked over on the way to tearing apart the robot that was holding Ada.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: A second later, the robot holding him was in pieces, and he was standing on his own two feet again. The Social Harmony man had gone so pale he looked green in his natty checked suit and pink tie.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: Benny or Lenny pinned his arms in a tight hug and Natalie walked carefully to him and they regarded one another in silence.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: She slapped him abruptly, across each cheek. “Harming children,” she said. “For shame.”
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: Ada stood on her own in the corner of the room, crying with her mouth in a O.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: Arturo and Natalie both looked to her and she stood, poised, between them, before running to Arturo and leaping onto him, so that he staggered momentarily before righting himself with her on his hip, in his arms.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: “We’ll go with you now,” he said to Natalie. “Thank you,” she said.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: She stroked Ada’s hair briefly and kissed her cheek. “I love you, Ada.” Ada nodded solemnly.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: “Let’s go,” Natalie said, when it was apparent that Ada had nothing to say to her.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: Benny tossed the Social Harmony man across the room into the corner of a desk. He bounced off it and crashed to the floor, unconscious or dead.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: Arturo couldn’t bring himself to care which. Benny knelt before Arturo.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: “Climb on, please,” it said. Arturo saw that Natalie was already pig-a-back on Lenny. He climbed aboard.
scene_description: indoors, minimalist interrogation room, single table, harsh lighting, thick metal door

segment_text: They moved even faster than the black robots had, but the bitter cold was offset by the warmth radiating from Benny’s metal hide, not hot, but warm.
scene_description: outdoors, moonlit rolling farmlands, silhouetted trees, distant highway lights, dark sky

segment_text: Arturo’s stomach reeled and he held Ada tight, squeezing his eyes shut and clamping his jaw.
scene_description: outdoors, moonlit rolling farmlands, silhouetted trees, distant highway lights, dark sky

segment_text: But Ada’s gasp made him look around, and he saw that they had cleared the city limits, and were vaulting over rolling farmlands now, jumping in long flat arcs whose zenith was just high enough for him to see the highway—the 401, they were headed east—in the distance.
scene_description: outdoors, moonlit rolling farmlands, silhouetted trees, distant highway lights, dark sky

segment_text: And then he saw what had made Ada gasp: boiling out of the hills and ditches, out of the trees and from under the cars: an army of headless, eight-armed black robots, arachnoid and sinister in the moonlight.
scene_description: outdoors, moonlit rolling farmlands, silhouetted trees, distant highway lights, dark sky

segment_text: They scuttled on the ground behind them, before them, and to both sides. Social Harmony had built a secret army of these robots and secreted them across the land, and now they were all chasing after them.
scene_description: outdoors, moonlit rolling farmlands, silhouetted trees, distant highway lights, dark sky

segment_text: The ride got bumpy then, as Benny beat back the tentacles that reached for them, smashing the black robots with mighty one-handed blows, his other hand supporting Arturo and Ada.
scene_description: outdoors, moonlit rolling farmlands, silhouetted trees, distant highway lights, dark sky

segment_text: Ada screamed as a black robot reared up before them, and Benny vaulted it smoothly, kicking it hard as he went, while Arturo clung on for dear life.
scene_description: outdoors, moonlit rolling farmlands, silhouetted trees, distant highway lights, dark sky

segment_text: Another scream made him look over toward Lenny and Natalie. Lenny was slightly ahead and to the left of them, and so he was the vanguard, encountering twice as many robots as they.
scene_description: outdoors, moonlit rolling farmlands, silhouetted trees, distant highway lights, dark sky

segment_text: A black spider-robot clung to his leg, dragging behind him with each lope, and one of its spare arms was tugging at Natalie.
scene_description: outdoors, moonlit rolling farmlands, silhouetted trees, distant highway lights, dark sky

segment_text: As Arturo watched—as Ada watched—the black robot ripped Natalie off of Lenny’s back and tossed her into the arms of one of its cohort behind it, which skewered her on one of its arms, a black spear protruding from her belly as she cried once more and then fell silent.
scene_description: outdoors, moonlit rolling farmlands, silhouetted trees, distant highway lights, dark sky

segment_text: Lenny was overwhelmed a moment later, buried under writhing black arms.
scene_description: outdoors, moonlit rolling farmlands, silhouetted trees, distant highway lights, dark sky

segment_text: Benny charged forward even faster, so that Arturo nearly lost his grip, and then he steadied himself. “We have to go back for them—”
scene_description: outdoors, moonlit rolling farmlands, silhouetted trees, distant highway lights, dark sky

segment_text: “They’re dead,” Benny said. “There’s nothing to go back for.”
scene_description: outdoors, moonlit rolling farmlands, silhouetted trees, distant highway lights, dark sky

segment_text: Its warm voice was sorrowful as it raced across the countryside, and the wind filled Arturo’s throat when he opened his mouth, and he could say no more.
scene_description: outdoors, moonlit rolling farmlands, silhouetted trees, distant highway lights, dark sky

segment_text: Ada wept on the jet, and Arturo wept with her, and Benny stood over them, a minatory presence against the other robots crewing the fast little plane, who left them alone all the way to Paris, where they changed jets again for the long trip to Beijing.
scene_description: indoors, aircraft cabin, passenger seats, small windows, dim lighting

segment_text: They slept on that trip, and when they landed, Benny helped them off the plane and onto the runway, and they got their first good look at Eurasia.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: It was tall. Vertical. Beijing loomed over them with curvilinear towers that twisted and bent and jigged and jagged so high they disappeared at the tops.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: It smelled like barbeque and flowers, and around them skittered fast armies of robots of every shape and size, wheeling in lockstep like schools of exotic fish.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: They gawped at it for a long moment, and someone came up behind them and then warm arms encircled their necks. Arturo knew that smell, knew that skin.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: He could never have forgotten it. He turned slowly, the blood draining from his face.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: “Natty?” he said, not believing his eyes as he confronted his dead, ex-wife. There were tears in her eyes.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: “Artie,” she said. “Ada,” she said. She kissed them both on the cheeks.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: Benny said, “You died in UNATS. Killed by modified Eurasian Social Harmony robots. Lenny, too. Ironic,” he said.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: She shook her head. “He means that we probably co-designed the robots that Social Harmony sent after you.”
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: “Natty?” Arturo said again. Ada was white and shaking.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: “Oh dear,” she said. “Oh, God. You didn’t know—”
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: “He didn’t give you a chance to explain,” Benny said. “Oh, God, Jesus, you must have thought—”
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: “I didn’t think it was my place to tell them, either,” Benny said, sounding embarrassed, a curious emotion for a robot.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: “Oh, God. Artie, Ada. There are—there are lots of me. One of the first things I did here was help them debug the uploading process.”
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: “You just put a copy of yourself into a positronic brain, and then when you need a body, you grow one or build one or both and decant yourself into it. I’m like Lenny and Benny now—there are many of me.”
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: “There’s too much work to do otherwise.” “I told you that our development helped humans understand themselves,” Benny said.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: Arturo pulled back. “You’re a robot?”
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: “No,” Natalie said. “No, of course not. Well, a little. Parts of me.”
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: “Growing a body is slow. Parts of it, you build. But I’m mostly made of person.”
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: Ada clung tight to Arturo now, and they both stepped back toward the jet. “Dad?” Ada said.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: He held her tight. “Please, Arturo,” Natalie, his dead, multiplicitous ex-wife said.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: “I know it’s a lot to understand, but it’s different here in Eurasia. Better, too.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: I don’t expect you to come rushing back to my arms after all this time, but I’ll help you if you’ll let me. I owe you that much, no matter what happens between us.”
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: “You too, Ada, I owe you a lifetime.” “How many are there of you?” he asked, not wanting to know the answer.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: “I don’t know exactly,” she said. “3,422,” Benny said. “This morning it was 3,423.”
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: Arturo rocked back in his boots and bit his lip hard enough to draw blood. “Um,” Natalie said. “More of me to love?”
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: He barked a laugh, and Natalie smiled and reached for him. He leaned back toward the jet, then stopped, defeated.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: Where would he go? He let her warm hand take his, and a moment later, Ada took her other hand and they stood facing each other, breathing in their smells.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: “I’ve gotten you your own place,” she said as she led them across the tarmac. “It’s close to where I live, but far enough for you to have privacy.”
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: “What will I do here?” he said. “Do they have coppers in Eurasia?” “Not really,” Natalie said.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: “It’s all robots?” “No, there’s not any crime.” “Oh.”
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: Arturo put one foot in front of the other, not sure if the ground was actually spongy or if that was jetlag. Around him, the alien smells of Beijing and the robots that were a million times smarter than he.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: To his right, his wife, one of 3,422 versions of her. To his left, his daughter, who would inherit this world.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: He reached into his pocket and took out the tin soldiers there. They were old and their glaze was cracked like an oil painting, but they were little people that a real human had made, little people in human image, and they were older than robots.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: How long had humans been making people, striving to bring them to life? He looked at Ada—a little person he’d brought to life.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: He gave her the tin soldiers. “For you,” he said. “Daddy-daughter present.”
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: She held them tightly, their tiny bayonets sticking out from between her fingers. “Thanks, Dad,” she said.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: She held them tightly and looked around, wide-eyed, at the schools of robots and the corkscrew towers. A flock of Bennyslennys appeared before them, joined by their Benny.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: “There are half a billion of them,” she said. “And 3,422 of them,” she said, pointing with a small bayonet at Natalie.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: “But there’s only one of you,” Arturo said. She craned her neck.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky

segment_text: “Not for long!” she said, and broke away, skipping forward and whirling around to take it all in.
scene_description: outdoors, airport tarmac, futuristic curvilinear towers, numerous varied robots, bright sky
